szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.player.common

Class AbstractPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.player.common.AbstractPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BasePlayer, Player
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlayerA, PlayerB, PlayerC, PlayerNativeA

    public abstract class AbstractPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player
    An abstract superclass implementing the Player interface. This class contains code code and data which is presumed to be common across all player classes and so you can skip directly implementing the Player interface. Just extend this class and implement only the Player.act(PlayerToken) method or, if you need to set some more member variables on initialization or do some cleanup, you can simply override the other 2 methods initialize or deallocate, respectively.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected PlayerGameInterface gameInterface
      The PlayerGameInterface object passed on initialization to the player to get any game-related information (actors, nuggets, etc.).

      The GameShop object used for in-game purchases.
      protected PipeHead head
      The PipeHead object representing the collecting head of the pipe passed on initialization to the player.
      protected PipeBasic pipe
      The PipeBasic object representing the pipe the player controls during a game level.
      protected Stack<PipeSegment> segmentStack
      The Stack of PipeSegments of the pipe pipe passed on initialization to the player.
      protected Weapon weapon
      The Weapon the player wields.

      • gameInterface

        protected PlayerGameInterface gameInterface
        The PlayerGameInterface object passed on initialization to the player to get any game-related information (actors, nuggets, etc.).

        The PipeBasic object representing the pipe the player controls during a game level. Passed on initialization to the player.

      • segmentStack

        The Stack of PipeSegments of the pipe pipe passed on initialization to the player. Same as pipe.getSegmentStack().

        The PipeHead object representing the collecting head of the pipe passed on initialization to the player. Same as pipe.getHead().

        The Weapon the player wields. Same as pipe.getHead().getWeapon().

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayerToken

        public final void setPlayerToken(PlayerToken token)
        Description copied from interface: Player

        Called as first thing after player instantiation

        Sets the authentication token used during a game level to check in other methods defined here whether another player instance is attempting to call them to sabotage other players.

        Specified by:
        setPlayerToken in interface Player
        Parameters:
        token - the token to set on player creation.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(PlayerGameInterface gameInterface,
                       PipeBasic pipe,
                       PlayerToken token)
        Description copied from interface: Player

        Called when the player is created and after the PlayerToken is set.

        For practical purposes (ability to create class instances only through calling Class.newInstance(). Instantiation of any member variables the player wants to use is reserved for this method (and the constructor has no parameters).

        The code in this method should only be called if the player's token successfully validates the token passed as argument)

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Player
        Parameters:
        gameInterface - the interface to the game functionality for the player
        pipe - the pipe assigned to the player
        token - a PlayerToken used to authenticate that the caller is allowed to call this method.

      • deallocate

        public void deallocate()
        Description copied from interface: Player

        Called when the current game level ends.

        Could be used by native players to free resources that are not taken care of by the garbage collector.

        Currently no plans to implement native interface, but keeping this method for now.

        Specified by:
        deallocate in interface Player

      • isTokenSet

        protected final boolean isTokenSet()
        Checks if the token is set (i.e. not null). Only visible to subclasses of AbstractPlayer.
        Returns:
        boolean true if token is not null | false otherwise.

      • getToken

        protected final PlayerToken getToken()
        Gets the PlayerToken object that has been assigned to this player. Only visible to subclasses of AbstractPlayer.
        Returns:
        the token assigned to this player.
